com.flowpowered.react.body

Class RigidBody

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flowpowered.react.body.Body
      • com.flowpowered.react.body.CollisionBody
        • com.flowpowered.react.body.RigidBody

  • public class RigidBody
extends CollisionBody
    Represents a rigid body for the physics engine. A rigid body is a non-deformable body that has a constant mass. This class inherits from the CollisionBody class.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.flowpowered.react.body.CollisionBody

        Parameters:
        transform - The transform (position and orientation)
        mass - The mass
        inertiaTensorLocal - The local inertial tensor
        collisionShape - The collision shape
        id - The ID

        Parameters:
        inertiaTensorLocal - The local inertia tensor to set

      • getInertiaTensorWorld

        public Matrix3x3 getInertiaTensorWorld()
        Gets the inertia tensor in world coordinates. The inertia tensor I_w in world coordinates is computed with the local inertia tensor I_b in body coordinates by I_w = R * I_b * R^T, where R is the rotation matrix (and R^T its transpose) of the current orientation quaternion of the body.
        Returns:
        The world inertia tensor

      • getInertiaTensorInverseWorld

        public Matrix3x3 getInertiaTensorInverseWorld()
        Gets the inverse of the inertia tensor in world coordinates. The inertia tensor I_w in world coordinates is computed with the local inverse inertia tensor I_b^-1 in body coordinates by I_w = R * I_b^-1 * R^T, where R is the rotation matrix (and R^T its transpose) of the current orientation quaternion of the body.
        Returns:
        The world inverse inertia tensor

      • applyForceToCenter

        public void applyForceToCenter(Vector3 force)
        Applies an external force to the body at its gravity center. If the body is sleeping, calling this method will wake it up. Note that the force will be added to the sum of the applied forces and that this sum will be reset to zero at the end of each call of the DynamicsWorld.update() method.
        Parameters:
        force - The force to apply

      • applyForce

        public void applyForce(Vector3 force,
                       Vector3 point)
        Applies an external force to the body at a given point (in world-space coordinates). If the point is not at the center of gravity of the body, it will also generate some torque and therefore, change the angular velocity of the body. If the body is sleeping, calling this method will wake it up. Note that the force will be added to the sum of the applied forces and that this sum will be reset to zero at the end of each call of the DynamicsWorld.update() method.
        Parameters:
        force - The force to apply
        point - The point to apply the force to

      • applyTorque

        public void applyTorque(Vector3 torque)
        Applies an external torque to the body. If the body is sleeping, calling this method will wake it up. Note that the force will be added to the sum of the applied torques and that this sum will be reset to zero at the end of each call of the DynamicsWorld.update() method.
        Parameters:
        torque - The torque to apply

      • getExternalForce

        public Vector3 getExternalForce()
        Returns the total external force.
        Returns:
        The external force

      • getExternalTorque

        public Vector3 getExternalTorque()
        Returns the total external torque.
        Returns:
        The external torque
